EDIT at 907.5 hours (original was at 87 hours). - This game is still fun, and I still play a lot, as evidenced that I've put 830 hours in it over the course of this last year. I generally enjoy the new content that the devs release, however the issues are glaring. The development team will constantly break the game and show no remorse, you may run into game breaking issues that cause your matches to be unfun or unfair, and that's just the sad reality. The update cycle for this game is on a 3 month period, where there's only one decent update after about 45 days, and then a major one at the 90 day mark. Unfortunately, with each issue fixed, they break a dozen other things. There's some issues that have remained in the game for so long they might as well be indefinite. The problems plaguing the game wouldn't be so bad if the dev team were transparent, however they are not. Just recently, a month after the release of the newest killer Pinhead, they disclosed that they'd been working with a company for NFTs. The dev team clearly do not care as they claim to "be proud" of their decisions, lining their pockets with toxic money, meanwhile their game is in total chaos as a third of the maps are disabled, several of the survivors faces are broken, and their newest survivor has perks that are disabled because they're broken on release. If you get this game, you'll have fun, but you're also going to have a slog to get through. Get ready for a lot of disappointment and a handful of worthless bloodpoints to compensate.

This game is a ton of fun. Don't let the toxic assholes tell you otherwise. I play solo mostly, both as a killer and as a survivor, and if you play the game and are friendly and honest then you can make some cool friends. There's a ton of DLC for this game but don't let that overwhelm you, you can easily get good games with the vanilla stuff. The game has been updated a lot over the years and it has made some really good additions. You're gonna have a bad time early on cause the learning curve is super unforgiving, especially when faced against killers or survivors you've never seen before. But figuring this stuff out in game is super rewarding. I hope you give this game a try, and I'll see you in this nightmare. Remember: Death is not an escape.

It is a game that is addictive in my opinion, but the one thing that is a warning is some players camp. It is not a officially rule of the game, but it is a unspoken rule amongst all who play this game. If you chose to get this game please dont camp you make other players furious. I have cussed out players out loud and not to their face. other than that it is a good game, you will like certain killers. I really hope you get it and please if you do play against me as a killer, dont camp. That's the only issue i have with the game. Who knows maybe the creators will decide to make it a official rule of the game sooner or later. :)

When it first came out I loved it. I still like the game play. But the updates to the game over the years have not been well optimized and if you have a lower end PC or last gen console (Xbox 1S or PS4) you will suffer from FPS drops and game freezes that will make the game borderline unplayable. There is also a long grind that will require you to put thousands of hours into (I'm not exaggerating) to be able to get the perks and items you want across the large number of killers and survivors.

If you are thinking about purchasing this game but do not like long grinds or have a lower end PC or last gen console, I would not recommend buying this. There are even reports of people with medium/high end PCs and the latest and greatest consoles experiencing some issues. 

In 2019, BHVR said they were committed to 60 FPS for console. They have not reached that goal and as of writing this, they are silent on social media to the countless people asking for improvements.
